intro: Jumellea stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf jumellea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in whorls, typically displaying shades of purple or pink. Jumellea stenophylla is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest margins.
